page.title: 13BULL TESTING STATION 1
page.content: At Mitchmore Farm, between Dinedor and Holme Lacy just south of Dinedor Mill (which we think is the Mill mentioned in the first Domesday Survey), is the {Bull Testing Station. }There are only {3 such stations in Britain,}run by the {Meat and Livestock Commission. }Only farmers who belong to the Livestock Commission Pedigree Scheme can send their animals here. They send them to get an{accurate assessment of how their{animals put on weight}so that they know how best to breed from them and other farmers know what they are buying. Every month a new lot of bulls aged about{5 or 6 months}comes in, and they stay for{7 months. }It costs a farmer{Â£400}to have each of his bulls assessed. There are 9 acres, with 4 big pens and 8 paddocks, run by a manager, 2 stockmen, and 2 part-time stockmen.
